main event: Multiple sightings of an unidentified aerial object over Sioux Falls, South Dakota on August 7-8, 1950.
interesting points: The object was observed visually and detected on radar, maintaining a steady course and speed for 15 minutes before abruptly changing direction and increasing speed rapidly.
No known aircraft were operating in the area at the time of the sightings.
The object was described as a 'brilliant orange' or white or red light, with no sound or trail.
The object was observed moving faster than typical aircraft at the time.
The sighting was considered most positively unexplainable as a natural phenomenon, and a full investigation was requested.
sighted object: Unidentified aerial object, described as a 'brilliant orange' or white or red light
witnesses: Sergeant James Walker, USAF, and other unspecified witnesses
